a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 15"
and h1 : "k = 3"
shows  "n choose k = 455"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\dbinom{15}{3}$. The final Answer is 455
 ### Proof
 \begin{align} \dbinom{15}{3} &= \dfrac{15!}{12!3!} \\ &= \dfrac{15\times 14\times 13}{3\times 2\times 1} \\ &= \dfrac{15}{3} \times \dfrac{14}{2} \times \dfrac{13}{1} \\ &= 5\times 7\times 13 \\ &= \boxed{455}.
 \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 15"
and h1 : "k = 3"
shows  "n choose k = 455"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: What is the value of the binomial coefficient "15 choose 3"? The final answer is 455.

a_1.formal problem:

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 15"
and h1 : "k = 3"
and h2 : "binomial n k = fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k))"
shows  "binomial n k = 455"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\dbinom{15}{3}$. The final Answer is 455
 ### Proof
 \begin{align} \dbinom{15}{3} &= \dfrac{15!}{12!3!} \\ &= \dfrac{15\times 14\times 13}{3\times 2\times 1} \\ &= \dfrac{15}{3} \times \dfrac{14}{2} \times \dfrac{13}{1} \\ &= 5\times 7\times 13 \\ &= \boxed{455}.
 \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 15"
and h1 : "k = 3"
and h2 : "binomial n k = fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k))"
shows  "binomial n k = 455"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: Compute the binomial coefficient $\binom{15}{3}$, which is $\frac{15!}{3!(15-3)!}$. The final answer is 455.

fixes n k :: nat

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n k :: nat and binomial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n k. binomial n k = fact n div (fact k * fact (n-k))"
shows  "binomial 15 3 = 455"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\dbinom{15}{3}$. The final Answer is 455
 ### Proof
 \begin{align} \dbinom{15}{3} &= \dfrac{15!}{12!3!} \\ &= \dfrac{15\times 14\times 13}{3\times 2\times 1} \\ &= \dfrac{15}{3} \times \dfrac{14}{2} \times \dfrac{13}{1} \\ &= 5\times 7\times 13 \\ &= \boxed{455}.
 \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes n k :: nat and binomial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n k. binomial n k = fact n div (fact k * fact (n-k))"
shows  "binomial 15 3 = 455"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Find the binomial coefficient for choosing 3 items out of 15, i.e., calculate $\binom{15}{3}$. The final answer is 455.
